What Is A Christian 22 Christian Is A New Man
What Is The Normal Christian Life?
What Is The World Coming To
What Is Your Name?
description: A message on honesty and humility.

title: What Is the Recession For?
description: This is a message about God’s purposes in the recession. By recession I don’t have any sophisticated definition in mind. I just mean various financial setbacks like business slowdown, decreasing profits, massive layoffs and joblessness, the bursting of the housing bubble, thousands of foreclosures, personal and business bankruptcies, bank failures, investment company collapses, the loss of retirement funds, and the social ills and unrest that go with the downturn. God is sovereign over these things, he foresees them all, he causes or permits them all, and when he causes or permits something, he does so with purpose and design.

title: What It Means To Be A Light
What It Means To Be Lost
What It Means To Be Saved
What It Takes to Be a Man
What Makes the Good News Good? Seeing the Glory of Christ
description: What is the highest, final good of the gospel?  Is it deliverance from hell?  Justification?  Forgiveness of sins?  John Piper says it is seeing and savoring the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.  When we see Christ in the right place in the gospel, we will be effective ambassadors in proclaiming the good news to the lost.

title: What Manner of Persons Ought Ye to Be
What Salvation Looks Like from Gods Perspective
What Should the Church Be Like
description: Nelson Price examines the church in Thessalonica as an example of what the church should be like today.  He explains that, according to 1 Thessalonians 1, the church should have: 1) Proper concepts, 2) Productive characteristics, 3) Positive compliance, and 4) Purposeful concentration.  Listen as he explains these attributes and be challenged to follow the Thessalonians example.

title: What The Spirit Says: Ephesus
description: Message was given at a Conference at the Bible Institute of Los Angeles.

title: What Time is it? Christ's Coming
description: This message speaks of the closeness of Christ's second coming. 'It is very late in the history of mankind.'

title: What To Do If You Don't Want Revival
description: 4 things that hinder real revival.

title: What To Do When The Stock Market Falls!
What To Do When You've Had Enough
description: Discouragement does not have to rule our lives.

What Will Keep You on the Mission Field?

What and Where Is Heaven
description: McGee begins his message   by reminding us that the Bible says little about   heaven.  However, he does not leave us disappointed!He extracts teachings from John 14 and Revelation 21 in such a way that a longing for heaven is stirred within us. He begins by describing characteristics of heaven that are of lesser  interest and progresses towards the most  exciting aspect of our hope: “Behold, I make all things new.”

title: What in The World Has Happened to You?
What is Worldliness?
description: McGee asks the question “What is Worldliness?” He begins his answer by first dismissing some of the more popular answers such as carnal amusement, running with wrong people, inappropriate dress, preoccupation with money, and neglecting the church. Instead, true worldliness is the jealousy, the pride, the rivalries, and the selfish ambitions we invite into our churches. The sermon ends with a call for renewed consecration to God and humble communion with one another.

title: What is Your Ambition in Life?
What is the Baptism of the Holy Spirit?
What is your Life?
description: A scriptural reminder that this life is brief and uncertain. Yet in a world of uncertainty McGee reminds believers they can be sure of their salvation!  Paul’s words are used to sum up this certainty in Jesus Christ: “I know whom I have believed, and I am pursuaded that he able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day.” The sermon ends with the simple profound invitation. “Come now.”

title: What it Means to Be Under Discipline of Christ in the Church
What on earth is God doing
What think ye of Christ?
description:
Rev 5:9 He is Worthy.
1Peter 2:7 He is Precious.
Song of Solomon 5:16 He is altogether Lovely.
Isaiah 9:6 He is Wonderful. 

What an absolutely beautiful sermon about Jesus! This sermon is an absolute MUST HEAR! We need more sermons about Jesus just like this one, that stick to the Bible.

title: What to Expect When God Touches Your Church
description: This message was just addressed to a church who just experienced a touch of God. Dr. Blackaby focuses on people sharing with one another what God is doing in their lives. He also says to be careful not to interfere with what God is doing in another person's life.

title: Whatever Happened to Repentance Preaching
description: There are very few messages on repentance these days. Contemporary churches would rather appease the congregation than to preach the offense of the cross. There is a thirst all around the world today for truth. The only way for people to be healed and enter into the power and rest of Christ is through repentance. The Holy Spirit is grieved at those who never enter into the Joy of Jesus through repentance. The devil is after the fruitfulness and Christ likeness in our lives. The devil will send foxes to hinder our fruitfulness. Jesus will come and call us to rise up with Him and He will battle for us and go after these foxes. We must be fully convinced of the love of God and His desire to fight against our enemies and to keep us by His power. He will do battle with us and for us.

title: Whatever Is Not from Faith Is Sin
Whats wrong with the gospel - Part 1
description: This message deals with false ideals and expectations that many professing Christian's have about God. It is an awesome message and a great challenge and encouragement to all believers to walk in the Light of the Word. Keith gives a pointed listing of the "traditions of men" that have somehow become deeply ingrained in today's message but bear no resemblance to what Jesus actually taught.

title: Whats wrong with the gospel - Part 2
description: This message deals with false ideals and expectations that many professing Christian's have about God. It is an awesome message and a great challenge and encouragement to all believers to walk in the Light of the Word. Keith gives a pointed listing of the "traditions of men" that have somehow become deeply ingrained in today's message but bear no resemblance to what Jesus actually taught.

title: Whats wrong with the gospel - Part 3
description: This message deals with false ideals and expectations that many professing Christian's have about God. It is an awesome message and a great challenge and encouragement to all believers to walk in the Light of the Word. Keith gives a pointed listing of the "traditions of men" that have somehow become deeply ingrained in today's message but bear no resemblance to what Jesus actually taught.

title: Whats wrong with the gospel - Part 4
description: This message deals with false ideals and expectations that many professing Christian's have about God. It is an awesome message and a great challenge and encouragement to all believers to walk in the Light of the Word. Keith gives a pointed listing of the "traditions of men" that have somehow become deeply ingrained in today's message but bear no resemblance to what Jesus actually taught.

title: When Christ Comes To His Church
description: August 8, 2004 - If there is unforsaken sin in our heart it makes it impossible for the Holy Spirit to flow through us. But for the Christian that really wants the heart of God and desires the fullness of Christ, you will go into the refiners fire. Each one will go through our own fire according to the impurities that is in us. God will allow this fire for the last days so He can raise up a tried and tested army.

title: When God Comes Down
description: August 17, 2008 - God is calling the people in the the body of Christ to begin to stir themselves up for the latter rain. When we choose to wait in the Lord the Holy spirit will bring our focus back to Jesus and winning lost souls. When the Holy Ghost comes down there are three evidences. First, He will renew our hunger for the presence of Jesus and put an expectation in our heart. Second, there will be an outbreak of gladness that is indescribable in its power. And last, the body of Christ will be awakened to the coming of the Lord. Our prayer will be, "Come Lord Jesus, come!"

title: When God Sets His Heart On You
description: God still has His heart set on saving this world. He loves mankind, and He is still moving by His Holy Spirit. God's heart is set on His church, in spite if all the apostasy and false teachers, He will not allow the Cross of Jesus Christ to be in vain. The Lord is calling us to complete confidence in the remission of sins. God's plan for us is not to walk in guilt and condemnation, He is calling us to enjoy Jesus and trust in the Power of the Blood of Jesus. When we embrace this we will come into truly find rest in Jesus.

title: When God Will Shut the Door
description: It is not a popular thought, but one day God will shut the door of salvation. He is longsuffering, but He will not allow sin to enter heaven. This is an earnest appeal to not reject God's merciful offer of salvation.

title: When He Was on the Cross
When Hope Is All Gone, Help Is On The Way
When I Survey The Wonderous Cross
When I Survey The Wondrous Cross
When I Survey The Wondrous Cross
When I survey the Wonderous Cross
When I survey the Wondrous Cross
When Is It Right to Repay Evil With Pain?
When Jacob Met the Apostle Paul
When Jacob Met the Apostle Paul
When Jesus Lays His Hands on You
When My Heart is Overwhelmed
description: In this sermon Mrs Daniel shares her heart with a group of women on the times when everyone gets 'overwhelmed'! She quotes many great old hymns, peoms and shares great encouraging stories to help us understand that Christ is the rock we can stand on all the time.

title: When My Savior Talks with Me
When Preachers Do Not Preach Against Sin
When Skeletons Come Out of Closets
description: When Skeletons Come Out of Closets was preached in a red hot revival service. Preacher -- here is the way it's supposed to be done. Christian -- there is water here if your soul needs an oasis. Seeker of truth -- if you are worried about life after death, about how to have peace with God--here is the answer from God's word, the Holy Bible. "Everybody that goes to hell gets exactly what he deserves. He walks up to the ticket window and pays his own fare to hell -- in wages! But everybody that goes to heaven rides on a free pass."

title: When Things Aren't Good, God Still Is
When Wales Caught The Fire Of The Holy Ghost - The 1904 Welsh Revival
description: A Wonderfully Moving and Living Account of how God moved in such a marvellous way during the 1904 Revival in Wales. The Spirit of God came down upon the entire nation for many years as God renewed all people to Himself. Over half the nation was converted to God within 1 year.

title: When a Man of God Loses His Faith
description: Preaching from 2 Chronicles, Wilkerson preaches using King Asa as an example.  Paul recorded in his writings that the Old Testament is there as an example to us so we need to heed what is being said.  This message should cause us all pause long enough to examine ourselves.

title: When the Call to Pray Becomes More Than Just a Cliché
When the Flesh Has a Grip
When the Holy Spirit departs
description: Every pastor and leader should hear this message. A warning of "when the Holy Spirit" departs from an individual.

title: When the Lights Go Out on the Road to Hell
When the Reaper Overtakes the Plowman - David Guzik
When the Saved Shout Hallelujah as God Sends People to Hell
When the bridegroom is taken away they will fast with new wineskins
Where Did the Puritans Come From?
description: nil

title: Where Revival Begins- Isaiah 6
description: Personal revival is a 'revolution of our self-image', encompassing four areas: pride of self, standard of self, death of self, and revival of Himself.  Ralph Sutera appeals for us to have a Judgment Day honesty about our own hearts that strips away self-sufficiency and a self-esteem that thrives on revealing the sins of other people and not one's self.  (72 minutes)

title: Where To Find Spiritual Reality & How To Get It
Where would you pitch your tent?
Who Are The People Called Puritans?
Who Does God Think He Is Anyhow?
Who Is Guarding The Front Door Of Your Home
description: We must examine ourselves for how we raised our children, and live our lives, for we will stand before a holy God and give account. Parents are responsible for what comes into their homes. Watchmen and guards must be appointed and we must all fast and pray for our homes and families. Pastor Wilkerson uses Nehemiah as an example of a caring watchman who was burdened for Israel when they were rebuilding the walls of the broken down city of Jerusalem.

title: Who Is The Builder -- The Originator Of The Church
description: Brother Stephen talks about the originator of the Church, and why God decided to establish the church.

title: Who is on the Lord's Side
Who's Slave Are You?
description: Everyone is a slave to something or someone, who are you a slave to? What do you think about most? Paul Washer shares his heart on this very strong subject and potent scripture. What depths there are in every verse of scripture, hear brother washer share on Romans 1:1.

title: Whose image does your face reflect?
Why Are People Falling Out of the Church?
Why Are You Weeping
description: Sometimes in our trials, we see our hurt and loss, but we can't at times see through our grief to understand we serve a living Jesus who has not left us alone. Too often we focus on our pain when we hurt so much we can't pray, because we don't know what to do. We might know the Lord in the fellowship of his suffering, but do we know him in the power of his resurrection? Every believer in trials needs this one.

title: Why Christ Became a Servant of the Jews
Why Christ Died And Rose Again
Why Christ Offends Men - Charles Spurgeon (read by Paul West)
Why Did Jesus have to Die?
Why Do We Need to Be Born Again? - Part 1
Why Doesn't My Christianity Work At Home
description: When we get into strife, striving in our spirit, communicating and relating to others with harshness, or argumentative debate, that hinders the flow of God's power and presence in our lives. We need to have the power to not get into strife in our household, not be drawn into it. Not making loud demands of others. The Holy Spirit will not move over that. There won't be a noise and striving to be recognized. That is the person in whose life the Holy Spirit can be released. Some people nullify a good word from heaven because they get in strife, whether it's other's behaviors, or our own. When God gives us a word, he intends to stand by it. But when our lifestyle is out of order, it's hard for us to know God. It restricts what God wants to do in our homes. This is why Christianity doesn't work at home.

title: Why Don't You Just Drop Dead?
Why God Waits to Answer Our Prayers
Why I Believe Jesus is Coming Soon
Why I Believe Many Are Now Reprobate
Why I Believe The Coming Of Lord Is Near
Why I Don't Have A Television
description: This message is a wake-up call to those who believe that the TV is harmless, or that it can be controlled. Many scriptures are used to show that the majority of the things presented on television are detrimental and offensive to God.

title: Why Sit Here until we Die?
Why We Believe the Bible - Lesson 1
Why We Believe the Bible - Lesson 2
Why We Believe the Bible - Lesson 3
Why You Were Saved (a brief devotional)
Why do the Heathen Rage
description: This is a heavy, yet necessary, message to the church in these last days.  Wilkerson reminds me of a grandfather that speaks sternly to his children strictly because he loves them. "Their father knew my Father. But my Father is STRONGER than their Father!" is a recurring statement and theme in this sermon. Preaching from Psalms 2, we learn what it is about the righteous that gets the world bunched up.  Learn where this rage comes from and why there is such a hatred for righteousness.

title: Why is it So Hard for Christians to Pray
description: There are many reasons why so many Christians find it hard to pray. But prayer is a necessity, not a luxury. If we give God quality time he will answer us. When we mix our prayers with faith, they will work.  To neglect prayer is to neglect God and the salvation he gave us. To not take advantage of the access given to us through the blood of Jesus is to take it lightly and do despite to the grace of God. Now more than ever the church needs to be praying.

title: Why is the House of God Forsaken
Why the World Hates Christians
description: Jesus has chosen and ordained us to go and bring forth a lasting fruit.  In doing this you must expect to be hated by the world but that is how it is supposed to be.  But this message takes a different look at the reason the world hates Christians.  There are many ministers today that have traveled the world to make folks twice the son of hell as they are.  As Scripture says in the 2nd Chapter of Romans…  “the name of God is blasphemed by the Gentiles because of you.

title: Why would GOD have mercy on us
Wild Donkeys
description: This message has to do with overpowering lust and lingering habits that you cannot seem to get victory over.  This is a must message for anyone that finds themselves struggling in these areas.

title: Will I See My Loved One Again?
Will The Real Bride Please Step Forward
Will You Be His Disciple?
description: Jesus is calling to all people, from all walks of life, to 'come and follow Me'. His disciples left their occupations and their families to follow Him. This Man had nowhere to lay His head. He took them in a boat into a storm while He took a nap...but they followed. Will YOU be a disciple of such a Man?

title: Will You Stand Or Fall In The Coming Storm
Will the Real Messiah Please Rise?
Winning Christ
description: I have recorded this sermon more than any others by far. I have sat many of my friends down and made them listen to this tape and they have thanked me for it. "This is the first tape I have ever said, 'Amen!' to!" was the response of my friends. I would definitely consider this one of the best sermons I have ever listened to. - Jeremy Hulsey

title: Winning, Winning, Winning
description: Are you testifying about the Lord?  Mark Cahill shows how souls are won through properly using the law (such as the Ten Commandments) to bring a person to see they are a "complete, total pagan sinner".  Then and only then can one truly see their need for a Savior in Jesus Christ.

title: Witchcraft In The Church
description: This is not a message on actual witches pulling their hoodoo voodoo on the church but is a message that should bring conviction on a large part of the church population today.  If you hate godly conviction and enjoy your lukewarm or cold state then pass this message by.

title: With God All Things Are Possible
Without Fault Before The Throne Of God
Without spot or wrinkle
description: There is the way of the world and God's way of holiness. The world gets engaged with a party, drinking and boozing, but we as Christians do it in God's house with prayer and in holiness. Some say that there are many ways to celebrate an engagement. Yes, there certainly are many ways to hell but only one way to heaven. The ring the young man gives to his future bride is a token and promise that he will keep himself pure for her until the day of marriage; in receiving the ring, the girl makes the same promise. Young people should live like Mary the mother of Jesus. When the angel told her that she would bare a son, she replied, “How can this be, since I do not know a man?” (Luke 1:34) She lived a holy and pure life as we read in 1Cor 7:34, “The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit.”

title: Witness a Revival 1st Hand - 1970 Film of Asbury College's Revival
description: Listen to a Real Revival that took place in 1970 at Asbury College in Kentucky. Told by the former President Dr. Dennis Kinlaw, who missed it completely and the world got to see it on the news (except for those blessed enough to either be there or traveled there). This 37-minute video presentation, narrated by the former president of Asbury College, is a powerful look into an incredible revival at that campus in 1970. A chapel service that began on Tuesday, February 3 went on without intermission for eight straight days. 'An amazing openness and transparency' among the students and an awesome awareness of the presence of God typified those precious days of visitation. 'God has come to Asbury.'

title: Witnesses Against You
description: “I set a great assembly against them.” — Nehemiah 5:7. THE facts are these. At the time when certain of the Jews returned with Nehemiah to Jerusalem, many of them were in very straitened circumstances; and, contrary to the Jewish law, the richer Jews lent them money upon usurious interest, amounting to the hundredth per month, or twelve per cent. per annum. They took from their poorer brethren their lands, or put a heavy mortgage upon them; and in some cases took the men themselves to be slaves for debts which they had unavoidably incurred. Now, as you know, every Jew was a landholder, and his land, if mortgaged for a time, must return free to him in the fiftieth year; and, though a Jew might for a while become a servant to his Jewish brother, yet he must go out free at the end of the seventh year. He could only be bound for a short period of servitude. Nehemiah called to him, therefore, the elders, and nobles, and rulers of Jerusalem, and showed them how wrong they were to hold their poorer brethren in bondage. 'Ye exact usury, every one of his brother,' he says; and he rebukes them sharply for it. When he found that his own words were scarcely powerful enough with them, he gathered together the people, and let them all have a voice, and in the many voices there was power...

title: Woe To Them That Are At Ease In Zion
Women's Rights - The Bible's First Suffragettes
Word That Comes Worshipping, The: Savoring What We Say Of God
Word That Kindles Worship, The: Showing The Glories Of God
Words to Winners of Souls - Part 1 (Audio Book)
Words to Winners of Souls - Part 2 (Audio Book)
Worship
description: Worship is something we give our life, strengthe and heart to and it satisfies. God created human beings to worship and they will worship something. David is a great example of a true worshipper. His life illustrates the value of worshipping God in spirit and in truth

title: Worship - Wednesday Morning Canton
description: The worship singing of conference was led by Jeff Woolridge and the special singing was done by Abagail Miller. There was simple piano accompanying the singing. Our aim was to simply put the focus on God above and not on a worship band or loud music. God honored this time with the godly sanctified music with His presence.

title: Worship Atlanta - You Must Return To Me
Worship Greenock - Idle Hands by Mary Peckham
Worship Greenock - Set Scotland On Fire by Mary Peckham
Worship Greenock - Special Singing by Ailen Gilchrist
Worship Medley (Name Is Great, John, Follow Jesus)
Worship That Comes By The Word, The: Satisfaction In The Greatness Of God
Worship in the Midst of War
Would You Sell Out For a Dream?
Yarib: Defender Of The People
description: When we come to God in prayer there has to be an active part on our behalf to believe Him to answer our prayers. If we have areas in our life that has never been confronted by the Holy Ghost we will become passive in our walk with God and be moved to unbelief. The heart of Jesus is to come and do for us what we can’t do for ourselves

title: Ye Shall Receive Power
description: The greatest need of our day for believers is surely presented here by the Rev. Magee. Oh that men and women all over this world would have this truth burning in their souls - this is the road to revival in our country.

title: Ye are the light of the World - Ye are the salt of the earth
description: Pastor Fitch begins by saying that the Beatitudes represent the kind of man Christ wants to make us into, this is the kind of person our Lord wants to send out into the world to be light in the darkness. He illustrates how this world is rotten and base and how ever whim of man tends to evil always. But it is the light of our testimony that will reveal the living God to a world that needs Him so desperately.

title: Years I Spent in Vanity and Pride
Yeild Not to Temptation
You Ain't Seen Nothing Yet
description: What will happen after the rapture of the Church?

title: You Are Dearly Loved By God
description: An indepth look into the passages in the Song of Solomon. Paul explores the richness of the Bridegroom's love for His Bride and gives us the challenge of what our response should be. A message of true freedom and deep rest that needs to be listened to again and again.

title: You Are Dearly Loved By God (clip)
description: An indepth look into the passages in the Song of Solomon. Paul explores the richness of the Bridegroom's love for His Bride and gives us the challenge of what our response should be. A message of true freedom and deep rest that needs to be listened to again and again.

title: You Are My All and All
You Are My God/Lord Jesus, How Beautiful You Are/Fairest Lord Jesus/Crown Him
You Can't Resist the Holy Ghost and Get By
You Didn't Lose It, You Left It
You Have The Authority For The Job
You Need The Baptism Of The Holy Spirit
You Really Do Reap What You Sow
description: Good and bad.  Preaching out of Matthew 25, Wilkerson preaches from the parable of the talents.

title: You've Got to be in Christ
Young People Who Stand For God
Your Faith Is Going Into The Fire
Your Name Is Great (Live incl SW)
Your Redemption Draws Nigh
description: This man of God had a powerful evangelistic and healing ministry, preaching to massive crowds through England and Ireland in the 1920's and 1930's.  He also pioneered many Pentecostal churches.  This brief recording, only a little over three minutes, appears to have been recorded in England in the dark days of the 1930's just before W.W. II.

title: moderated by Sid Roth: Who Is Jesus? (debate)
